ygData.subject: Re: Polished Granite Tomahawk
ygData.msgSnippet: I only wish B were a valid option, but in some cases it is not.....ie Jboots, there is no substitue that I know of.  Rubicite armor is another prime example,
ygData.messageBody:
I only wish B were a valid option, but in some cases it is not.....ie Jboots, there is no substitue that I know of. Rubicite armor is another prime example, A, it looks very cool, B there is no other armor within my level range that I can find or buy that has the same or close to the stats of rubicite. Personally I'd be happy to sit and camp all day, but the problem is that some of these big guild guys will camp for days, long after they've already gotten the item, just so they can give it to their buddies.

>>> Kelly Pruett <pruett@...> 5.25.99 3:42:41 PM >>>
From: Kelly Pruett <pruett@...>

Excellent point. However ... I've played many many muds and other online games. It
will never happen. What I usually end up doing is this ... get the less sought
after item. I mean after all, what are we talking about here? Something that will
give a few more damage over an extremely long fight. So either,
A.) Sit and camp and be happy, or pay a high price that takes a month to save for
and be happy.

OR

B.) Do with something 'not as good' but easily obtained. And be moderately happy.

I've taken plan B many, many times simply because it's easier and I enjoy the game
more. If, by chance I come upon a great situation in which I can obtain a valuable
item, I do it. Otherwise, just have fun.

I remember a mud once where a particular item had a mob that required over 20
people coordinating an attack against it just to win. Imagine the nightmare of
trying to establish who gets looting on that. Screw that. I'm out for fun ... not
frustration.

-Faderic


Nick Morgowicz wrote:

> The price should not be for the people who spend 24 hours a day, 7 days a week
> playing. It should be something that the people who only have a couple hours a
> day to play can attain too.
>
> My opinion.
>
> Nick
